meanings.definition: The state or quality of being diluted.
meanings.sent1: The diluteness of the lemonade made it taste watery.
meanings.sent2: The diluteness of the paint affected its color intensity.
meanings.sent3: The diluteness of the soup was so extreme that it seemed like flavored water.
meanings.sent4: The diluteness of her perfume was like a whisper of scent in the air.
meanings.sent5: The diluteness of the ink made the writing look faint and blurry.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance is diluted.
meanings.sent1: The diluteness of the solution determined its effectiveness.
meanings.sent2: The diluteness of the medication affected its potency.
meanings.sent3: The diluteness of the juice was so high that it barely tasted like fruit.
meanings.sent4: The diluteness of his voice in the crowd made it hard to hear him.
meanings.sent5: The diluteness of the tea made it seem like colored water rather than a beverage.

meanings.sent1: The diluteness of the mixture was crucial for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The diluteness of the bleach solution needed to be precise for cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The diluteness of the sauce was accidental, but it turned out delicious.
meanings.sent4: The diluteness of her apology made it seem insincere.
meanings.sent5: The diluteness of the colors in the painting gave it a soft, dreamy quality.
